p: While electronic surveillance based on nonclinical data such as over-the-counter medication sales, school absenteeism, and health information seeking may provide preliminary signs of potential infection spread, prompt release of electronic health records (EHR) containing diagnosis and clinical outcomes can lead to a more informative and timely disease surveillance [ 20]. Increasing utilization of patient electronic records could play an important role in attaining public health objectives and complimenting other information sources.
